en.title: Overview - STACK Documentation
en.description: Comprehensive documentation for the STACK question type.

en.title: Site Map - STACK Documentation
en.description: A directory listing of all STACK documentation.

About.title: STACK Community
About.description: Information on the STACK community, including meetings, groups and how to contribute.

About.title: Contributors
About.description: Information on who has contributed to the STACK project.

About.title: Publications about STACK
About.description: STACK has been the subject of research, including published books and articles.

About.title: The Philosophy of STACK
About.description: Comprehensive documentation for the STACK question type.

About.title: About the STACK logo
About.description: Read about the mathematics behind the STACK logo.

About.title: About the STACK Project
About.description: STACK is an assessment system for mathematics, science and related disciplines designed to enable students to answer questions with a mathematical expression.

Authoring.title: Authoring - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Documentation for question authors using STACK, including a quick start guide and how to use common STACK features.

Authoring.title: Answer test results
Authoring.description: This page, automatically generated from the STACK unit tests, helps teachers understand what the answer tests actually consiser to be the same and different.

Authoring.title: Actuarial Notation - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: An overview of using actuarial notation in STACK.

Authoring.title: Author's FAQ - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Answers to questions frequently asked by question authors using STACK.

Authoring.title: Authoring Quick Start - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: The authoring quick start is a great place to start learning about using STACK. This step-by-step guide will teach you to create a basic question in STACK.

Authoring.title: Authoring Quick Start 2 - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with question variables, including a simple integration problem.

Authoring.title: Authoring Quick Start 3 - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: The third part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with improving feedback, including the Int and FacForm answer tests.

Authoring.title: Authoring Quick Start 4 - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with randomisation and deploying variants.

Authoring.title: Authoring Quick Start 5 - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with question tests.

Authoring.title: Authoring Quick Start 6 - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with multipart questions.

Authoring.title: Authoring Quick Start 7 - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with turning simplification off.

Authoring.title: Authoring Quick Start 8 - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start shows you how to import and export questions, as well as how to create a Moodle quiz.

Authoring.title: CAS Text - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information on writing CAS Text in STACK, including useful LaTex and html code.

Authoring.title: Curve Sketching - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: This document discusses curve sketching in STACK, including attempts to assess this skill and alternatives.

Authoring.title: STACK Sample Questions
Authoring.description: Sample questions for the STACK question type.

Authoring.title: STACK Sample Questions
Authoring.description: Sample questions for the STACK question type.

Authoring.title: Semi-automatic Marking
Authoring.description: Practical advice for combining STACK automatic marking with human-marked items.

Authoring.title: Answer Tests - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information about the different answer tests supported in the STACK online assessment system.

Authoring.title: Rules-based answer tests
Authoring.description: Information about creating bespoke answer tests by specifying algebraic rules.

Authoring.title: Deploying - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information about deploying random variants in the STACK online assessment system.

Authoring.title: Feedback - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information about creating feedback for students in the STACK online assessment system.

Authoring.title: I have a misbehaving STACK question in a live Moodle quiz.  What should I do?
Authoring.description: Advice on dealing with errors in STACK questions during a live quiz.

Authoring.title: Errors in question aurhoting - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: What errors that may appear during validation/saving of a question mean and what you can do about it.

Authoring.title: Answer Tests - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: An introduction to using equivalence reasoning in the STACK online assessment system.

Authoring.title: Fact Sheets - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: STACK lets question authors easily embed standard fact sheets into their questions.

Authoring.title: Ensuring a Question Works in the Future - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: This document provides guidelines for making sure a question will work in future updates of STACK or Moodle.

Authoring.title: HELM materials in STACK
Authoring.description: Providing versions of the HELM project materials as moodle quizzes, with materials in STACK format.

Authoring.title: Importing and Exporting - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information on importing and exporting questions in STACK.

Authoring.title: Inputs - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: STACK supports many different types of student input, including algebraic input, numerical input and multi-line input.

Authoring.title: JSXGraph - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: JSXGraph is a useful tool for creating graphs in your STACK questions.

Authoring.title: Assessment of proof
Authoring.description: This file contains advice on assessing mathematical proof.

Authoring.title: Question and Answer Variables - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information on defining and manipulating CAS variables in STACK.

Authoring.description: Information on writing STACK questions for several languages.

Authoring.title: Multiple Choice Questions - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information on creating and manipulating multiple choice questions in STACk.

Authoring.description: Information on finding the Moodle question bank.

Authoring.title: Options - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Documentation for the Option section in a STACK question.

Authoring.title: Potential Response Trees - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information on using potential response trees in the STACK online assessment system.

Authoring.title: Question Blocks - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information on using question blocks in STACK.

Authoring.title: Question Notes - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information on creating effective question notes for random questions in STACK.

Authoring.title: Adding Questions to a Quiz - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information on adding questions to a quiz in STACK.

Authoring.title: Reporting - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: You can generate detailed reports for quizzes using STACK to assess how successful they are.

Authoring.title: Tables - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Functions for typesetting mathematical tables, such a truth tables.

Authoring.title: Testing - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information on testing a STACK question.

Authoring.title: Scientific Units - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: STACK supports the use of scientific units in its questions. This is particularly useful in physics questions.

Authoring.title: Variant matching - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: This is a relatively advanced feature which links together random variables between questions.

Authoring.title: Numerical Input - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: Information on STACK's numerical input type.

Authoring.title: Numerical Answer Tests - STACK Documentation
Authoring.description: STACK can test numerical properties of a students' answer, including its numerical precision and significant figures.

CAS.title: CAS - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: STACK uses the computer algebra system (CAS) Maxima. This documentation deals with Maxima syntax for many topics commonly used in STACK.

CAS.title: Buggy Rules - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: In order to establish that the student has done something particular but wrong, it is useful for us to be able to apply wrong or buggy rules to expressions.

CAS.title: About Computer Algebra Systems - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information about Computer Algebra Systems for use with online assessment.

CAS.title: Differential Equations - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on representing, displaying and manipulating ODEs in STACK.

CAS.title: Discrete mathematics and graph theory - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on representing, displaying and manipulating graphs, as in graph theory rather than graph sketching.

CAS.title: Asking Students to Solve Equations - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: It is quite common to ask students to solve an algebraic equation. This document contains information on doing so effectively in STACK.

CAS.title: Reasoning by Equivalence - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Comprehensive information on the equivalence reasoning answer type in STACK.

CAS.title: The Greek Alphabet - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on displaying greek letters in STACK.

CAS.title: Inequalities - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on displaying inequalities, as well as functions that support inequalities.

CAS.title: Linear Algebra - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on working with linear algebra in a STACK question.

CAS.title: Matrices - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on using matrices and vectors in the STACK online assessment system.

CAS.title: Introduction to Maxima - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: An introduction to STACK's CAS system, Maxima.

CAS.title: Numbers in STACK - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on displaying numbers in STACK using the CAS Maxima.

CAS.title: Optimising Maxima - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Maxima is a slow interpreted language.  This file details several ways to reduce time needed by Maxima.

CAS.title: Writing a permutation as a product of disjoint cycles
CAS.description: Information on authoring questions involving permutation as a product of disjoint cycles.

CAS.title: Plots - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on plotting graphs in STACK.

CAS.title: Propositional Logic - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Support for propositional logic, using Maxima's logic package.

CAS.title: Predicate Functions - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Predicate functions are those that return Boolean values true or false. These are often useful when authoring STACK questions.

CAS.title: Random Objects - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on using different functions in STACK to generate random values.

CAS.title: Real intervals - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on representing, displaying and manipulating intervals in the real line.

CAS.title: Simplification - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on using simplification in STACK.

CAS.title: STACK-Maxima Sandbox - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: It is very useful when authoring questions to be able to test out Maxima code in the same environment in which STACK uses Maxima.

CAS.title: Statistics - STACK Documentation
CAS.description: Information on support for statistics in STACK.

Installation.description: *Information on installing STACK on your server.

Installation.title: LTI - STACK Documentation
Installation.description: Information on using LTI to provide STACK quizzes to learning systems where STACK is not installed.

Installation.title: Installing Mathjax - STACK Documentation
Installation.description: Information on installing MathJax, the filter STACK uses to convert LaTeX code into display.

Installation.title: Installing Maxima - STACK Documentation
Installation.description: Instructions on downloading and compiling Maxima, the CAS used for STACK.

Installation.title: Testing Installation - STACK Documentation
Installation.description: It is important to confirm that STACK has been installed correctly. This page provides instructions for confirming this.

Developer.description: Information on creating a new input type in the STACK online assessment system.

Developer.description: Information on STACK's documentation system and how to contribute to the STACK documentation.

Developer.description: Maxima has a very wide range of optional packages. Read about options for adding more Maxima packages to your installation of STACK.
